column1: Maintal is the second largest town of the Main-Kinzig district
column3: Germany. It is situated on the river Main
column4: between Frankfurt am Main and Hanau.

column1: The neighbouring countries of  Maintal are Niederdorfelden and Schöneck in the north
column2: the city of Hanau in the East
column3: Mühlheim am Main and Offenbach am Main on the other bank of the river Main as well as Frankfurt am Main in the west.

column1: Maintal consists of the four districts Dörnigheim
The city was artificially created in 1974 in the course of the Hessian administration reform by merging the city of Dörnigheim (now Maintal's biggest district) with the nearby towns of Bischofsheim

Maintal is connected with Hanau and Frankfurt by the so-called nordmainische Eisenbahn (northern Main railway) and has two stations (Maintal-West in Bischofsheim near the Main river and Maintal-East in Dörnigheim)
Two ferries cross the Main to the left
column3: bank. The Rumpenheim Ferry links Bischofsheim with Rumpenheim
column4: whilst the Maintal-Dörnigheim Ferry links Dörnigheim with Mühlheim am Main.
